alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Marion; Polk; Warren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 12:19AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Polk, northwestern Marion, southwestern Jasper and northeastern Warren Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1218 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pleasant Hill, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and additional rainfall up to one inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Polk, northwestern Marion, southwestern Jasper and northeastern Warren Counties, including the following locations... Margo Frankel Woods State Park, Ankeny Regional Airport, Hartford, Runnells, Weh-Weh-Neh-Kee State Park and Swan. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 87 and 91. Interstate 80 between mile markers 134 and 149. Interstate 235 between mile markers 7 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Des Moines .
